channel.title: edison on HERESY LEVAIN
channel.description: Latest experiments in edison from HERESY LEVAIN

item.title: Psychedelic Browniac
item.content:
I made a batch of sourdough oat brownies.

I toasted some oat groats (from Lonesome Whistle Farm, OR) and then milled them. These oat flour brownies (with sourdough discard) came out freakin' fabulous. Soft, fudgy, but not dense. Home-milled oat flour gives the brownies some nuttiness, even without nuts involved. (Not sure how Canadian oats compare to American oats.) Oat flour has no gluten, rendering the brownies practically impervious to overbaking. The sourdough doesn’t really give the brownie any lift – it just lends a whisper of tangy flavor that offsets the sweetness and complements the chocolate.

“There isn’t much a pan of warm brownies and a glass of milk will fix. In less it’s low grain prices. Or poverty. Or the national debt.” - Lois Greiman

Then a shipment of Edison arrived, before the brownies were gone.

Edison is a HWSW developed by the WSU Bread Lab, named after the nearby town of Edison, Washington, which had once been a wheat shipping port for Skagit Valley. Edison is now known as a reliable cultivar in western and central Oregon, western Washington and the Blue Mountain area. Protein content is 10%-13%.

A crazy idea popped into my head: marbled brownie bread! Heresy, I know!

But I made it.

It felt blasphemous. It felt momentous. It felt like a hot new scandal that should be exposed on The Late Show. Yet, for some odd reason, Stephen Colbert did not call me up for an interview.

Which is why I’m typing up this note right now. The world needs to know.

ingredient baker’s %
82% extraction wheat flour (Edison - Huntons' Farm, OR) 100%
rye levain 40%
water 87%
salt 1%
oat brownie 75%

Just mush up some brownie into a spreadable paste, and laminate into the dough during the last fold. Then cold-ferment for 24 hours.

It bakes into a light and fluffy semi-sweet bread.

The perfect PB delivery system.

A variation, made in March 2021.

Another variation with matcha and nuts, in June 2021.
